info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 5:36PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS PRODUCING HEAVY RAINFALL WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN MECKLENBURG AND WESTERN UNION COUNTIES UNTIL 630 PM EDT... At 535 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the leading edge of a cluster of heavy rain showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Uptown Charlotte to 10 miles southwest of Monroe, and moving east at 10 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Monroe, South Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Pineville, Wesley Chapel and Waxhaw. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Very heavy rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
